column4: what is the difference between .tar.gz and rpm? Which one should i choose?
i can't find vmware server there
I might be wrong.. but a tar.gz is just a compressed file... rpm is an installation package.. like the deb's ubuntu uses

if it's a program you've downloaded you'll have to compile it if you get the tar.gz file.. the deb should install if you're using a system that uses rpm (ie Fedora and some others). I think ubuntu can use an rpm too
